headline: Cities Experiment With Idea of Making a Ride on the Bus Free
abstract: Mayors are considering waiving fares for bus service as a way to fight inequality and lower carbon emissions. Critics wonder who will pay for it.
lead_paragraph: LAWRENCE, Mass. â€” Dionisia Ramos gets on the 37 bus twice a day, rooting through her handbag to dig out the fare and drop it into the slot, so it came as a shock several months ago when the bus driver reached out his hand to stop her.
